categories.name: Package Exports & Version
categories.description: Verifies that the package exports the correct API surface and version.

tests.name: version is exported as a string
list is exported as a function
steps is exported as a function
show is exported as a function

categories.name: list() API
categories.description: Tests algorithm listing, filtering by category, and error handling.

tests.name: Each algorithm has all required fields
tests.details: All 17 algorithms have fields: [id, name, category, description, difficulty, timeComplexity, spaceComplexity]

tests.name: All algorithm IDs are URL-safe strings
list({ category: 'classical' }) returns 7 algorithms
tests.details: binary-search, bfs, bubble-sort, dfs, dijkstra, merge-sort, quicksort

tests.name: list({ category: 'quantum' }) returns 0 algorithms (reserved)
tests.details: Category exists but has 0 algorithms (reserved for future)

tests.name: list() with invalid category throws Error
list() returns a new array each time (no shared reference)
Time complexity strings follow Big-O notation

categories.name: Expected Algorithm IDs
categories.description: Verifies that every expected algorithm is present in the catalog.

tests.name: Algorithm "binary-search" exists in catalog
tests.details: Binary Search | classical | beginner | O(log n)

tests.name: Algorithm "quicksort" exists in catalog
tests.details: QuickSort | classical | intermediate | O(n log n)

tests.name: Algorithm "merge-sort" exists in catalog
tests.details: Merge Sort | classical | intermediate | O(n log n)

tests.name: Algorithm "bfs" exists in catalog
tests.details: Breadth-First Search | classical | intermediate | O(V + E)

tests.name: Algorithm "dfs" exists in catalog
tests.details: Depth-First Search | classical | intermediate | O(V + E)

tests.name: Algorithm "dijkstra" exists in catalog
tests.details: Dijkstra's Shortest Path | classical | advanced | O((V + E) log V)

tests.name: Algorithm "perceptron" exists in catalog
tests.details: Single Neuron / Perceptron | deep-learning | beginner | O(n)

tests.name: Algorithm "feedforward-network" exists in catalog
tests.details: Feedforward Neural Network | deep-learning | intermediate | O(Σ n_l × n_{l-1})

tests.name: Algorithm "backpropagation" exists in catalog
tests.details: Backpropagation | deep-learning | intermediate | O(Σ n_l × n_{l+1})

tests.name: Algorithm "convolution" exists in catalog
tests.details: Convolution (2D) | deep-learning | intermediate | O(H × W × K² × C)

tests.name: Algorithm "gradient-descent" exists in catalog
tests.details: Gradient Descent | deep-learning | intermediate | O(T × d)

tests.name: Algorithm "tokenization-bpe" exists in catalog
tests.details: BPE Tokenization | generative-ai | beginner | O(n × m)

tests.name: Algorithm "token-embeddings" exists in catalog
tests.details: Token Embeddings | generative-ai | intermediate | O(n × d)

tests.name: Algorithm "self-attention" exists in catalog
tests.details: Self-Attention (Scaled Dot-Product) | generative-ai | intermediate | O(n² × d)

tests.name: Algorithm "multi-head-attention" exists in catalog
tests.details: Multi-Head Attention | generative-ai | advanced | O(h × n² × d_k)

tests.name: Algorithm "transformer-block" exists in catalog
tests.details: Transformer Block | generative-ai | advanced | O(n² × d + n × d × d_ff)

categories.name: steps() — Default Inputs
categories.description: Runs steps() for every algorithm using default inputs and validates the output structure.

categories.name: StepSequence Invariants
categories.description: Validates the mathematical and structural invariants of the step format for every algorithm.

categories.name: Cross-Algorithm Consistency
categories.description: Verifies structural consistency across all algorithms.

tests.name: All algorithms use the same formatVersion
All algorithms use the same generatedBy value
Step count summary across all algorithms
Visual action type coverage
tests.details: 47 unique visual action types used: [activateHead, activateNeuron, activateSublayer, compareElements, dimRange, highlightAuxiliary, highlightEdge, highlightElement, highlightKernelPosition, highlightRange, highlightToken, markFound, markPath, markPivot, markSorted, mergeTokens, movePointer, propagateSignal, setAuxiliary, setCurrentNode, setPartition, showActivationFunction, showAttentionScores, showAttentionWeights, showConcatenatedHeads, showConvolutionProducts, showDescentStep, showEmbedding, showFullAttentionMatrix, showGradient, showLandscapePosition, showLayerNorm, showLoss, showMessage, showPreActivation, showProjectionMatrix, showResidualConnection, showSimilarity, showTrajectory, showWeightedValues, showWeights, swapElements, updateDistance, updateNodeValue, updateWeights, visitNode, writeOutputCell]

tests.name: Phase usage across algorithms
tests.details:
11 algorithms use phases:
binary-search: [initialization, search, result]
perceptron: [input, weights, computation, activation, output]
feedforward-network: [initialization, forward-propagation, result]
backpropagation: [forward, loss, backward, update, complete]
convolution: [initialization, convolution, complete]
gradient-descent: [initialization, optimization]
tokenization-bpe: [initialization, merging, result]
token-embeddings: [initialization, lookup, similarity, result]
self-attention: [input, projection, scores, scaling, softmax, output, result]
multi-head-attention: [initialization, head-0, head-1, concatenation, projection, result]
transformer-block: [input, self-attention, add-norm-1, ffn, add-norm-2, result]

categories.name: Determinism
categories.description: Verifies that running steps() twice with the same inputs produces identical results.

algorithmDetails.name: Binary Search
algorithmDetails.description: Efficiently find a target in a sorted array by halving the search space.

sampleStep.title: Initialize Search
sampleStep.explanation: Searching for 13 in a sorted array of 10 elements. Setting left = 0, right = 9. The entire array is the search space.

algorithmDetails.name: Bubble Sort
algorithmDetails.description: Repeatedly swap adjacent out-of-order elements until the array is sorted.

sampleStep.title: Initialize Bubble Sort
sampleStep.explanation: Starting Bubble Sort on an array of 7 elements. We will make up to 6 passes through the array, comparing adjacent elements and swapping them if they are out of order.

sampleStep.title: Initialize QuickSort
sampleStep.explanation: Starting QuickSort on 7 elements. We will pick a pivot, partition the array around it, and recursively sort the two halves.

algorithmDetails.name: Merge Sort
algorithmDetails.description: Stable divide-and-conquer sort that merges sorted sub-arrays.

sampleStep.title: Initialize Merge Sort
sampleStep.explanation: Starting bottom-up Merge Sort on 7 elements. We will merge sub-arrays of increasing size: 1, 2, 4, ... until the entire array is sorted. This requires ⌈log₂(7)⌉ = 3 rounds.

algorithmDetails.name: Breadth-First Search
algorithmDetails.description: Explore a graph level by level using a queue.

sampleStep.title: Initialize BFS
sampleStep.explanation: Starting BFS from node "A". Searching for node "F". Enqueue "A" and mark it as visited.

algorithmDetails.name: Depth-First Search
algorithmDetails.description: Explore a graph by going as deep as possible before backtracking.

sampleStep.title: Initialize DFS
sampleStep.explanation: Starting DFS from node "A". Searching for "F". Push "A" onto the stack.

algorithmDetails.name: Dijkstra's Shortest Path
algorithmDetails.description: Find shortest paths between nodes in a weighted graph using a greedy approach.

sampleStep.title: Initialize Dijkstra's Algorithm
sampleStep.explanation: Starting Dijkstra's algorithm from node "A". Set distance to "A" = 0 and all others = ∞. Add "A" to the priority queue.

algorithmDetails.name: Single Neuron / Perceptron
algorithmDetails.description: Watch a single neuron compute: inputs × weights + bias → activation → output.

sampleStep.title: Input Values
sampleStep.explanation: The neuron receives 2 inputs: [0.5, 0.8]. Each input represents a feature or signal fed into the neuron.

algorithmDetails.name: Feedforward Neural Network
algorithmDetails.description: Watch data flow forward through a multi-layer neural network.

sampleStep.title: Network Architecture
sampleStep.explanation: Feedforward network with 3 layers: [2, 3, 1]. Input layer has 2 neurons receiving values [0.5, 0.8]. Using sigmoid activation. Weights initialized with Xavier initialization (seed: "eigenvue-ff").

algorithmDetails.name: Backpropagation
algorithmDetails.description: How neural networks learn: computing gradients through the chain rule.

sampleStep.title: Forward Pass Begins
sampleStep.explanation: Starting forward propagation with input [0.5, 0.8]. Target output: [1].

algorithmDetails.name: Convolution (2D)
algorithmDetails.description: How CNNs detect features: sliding a kernel across an input grid.

sampleStep.title: Input Grid & Kernel
sampleStep.explanation: Input is a 4×4 grid. Kernel is 2×2. Output will be 3×3 (valid convolution, no padding). The kernel slides across the input computing dot products at each position.

algorithmDetails.name: Gradient Descent
algorithmDetails.description: Optimization by following the steepest downhill direction on the loss landscape.

sampleStep.title: Initial Position
sampleStep.explanation: Starting at (3.0000, 3.0000) with loss = 36.0000. Using sgd optimizer with learning rate eta = 0.1. Loss surface: f(x, y) = x^2 + 3y^2. Minimum at origin (0, 0).

algorithmDetails.name: BPE Tokenization
algorithmDetails.description: Break text into subword tokens using Byte-Pair Encoding merge rules.

sampleStep.title: Split Into Characters
sampleStep.explanation: Starting with the text "lowest". Split into 6 individual characters: ["l", "o", "w", "e", "s", "t"].

algorithmDetails.name: Token Embeddings
algorithmDetails.description: Map tokens to dense numerical vectors using an embedding lookup table.

sampleStep.title: Input Token Sequence
sampleStep.explanation: We have 3 tokens: ["The", "cat", "sat"]. Each token will be mapped to a 4-dimensional embedding vector.

algorithmDetails.name: Self-Attention (Scaled Dot-Product)
algorithmDetails.description: Watch how each token decides which other tokens to pay attention to.

sampleStep.title: Input Embeddings
sampleStep.explanation: Starting with 3 tokens, each represented as a 4-dimensional embedding vector. These embeddings are the input matrix X with shape [3, 4].

algorithmDetails.name: Multi-Head Attention
algorithmDetails.description: See how multiple attention heads capture different relationships simultaneously.

sampleStep.title: Input Embeddings
sampleStep.explanation: Starting with 4 tokens, each as a 8-dimensional embedding. These will be processed by 2 attention heads, each with d_k = 4.

algorithmDetails.name: Transformer Block
algorithmDetails.description: Follow data through a complete transformer encoder block step by step.

sampleStep.title: Input Embeddings
sampleStep.explanation: Transformer block receives 3 tokens as 4-dimensional embeddings. The block will process them through self-attention, add & norm, FFN, and add & norm.
